title: Kevin Nee
text:
Kevin Nee (born August 21, 1985) is an American professional <a href="Strongman%20%28strength%20athlete%29">Strongman</a> athlete, who in 2007, at age 21, was the youngest person ever to reach the finals in the <a href="World%27s%20Strongest%20Man">World's Strongest Man</a>.
Biography.
Born in <a href="Framingham%2C%20Massachusetts">Framingham, Massachusetts</a>, Nee began his strength training at the age of 14. As a high school student at Hopedale High School in <a href="Hopedale%2C%20Massachusetts">Hopedale, Massachusetts</a>, he began competing in the teenage level Strongman competitions. He won the teenage heavyweight division of 2002 USA Teenage Strongman. Nee has competed in five of the <a href="World%27s%20Strongest%20Man">World's Strongest Man</a> championships. In 2005, he competed in the tournament held in <a href="Chengdu%2C%20China">Chengdu, China</a>; at the age of 20, he made history as the youngest competitor ever to compete in this annual sports event.
Nee also competed in the 2006 World's Strongest Man championship in <a href="Sanya">Sanya</a>, China, but did not make it to the final round of competition. In 2007, at the World's Strongest Man championship held in <a href="Long%20Beach%2C%20California">Long Beach, California</a>, Nee finished in eighth place. He has also competed in the annual World's Strongest Man Super Series Competition at <a href="Mohegan%20Sun">Mohegan Sun</a> in <a href="Uncasville%2C%20Connecticut">Uncasville, Connecticut</a>, where he finished fifth in 2006 and second in 2007.
While he was still competing as an amateur strongman, Nee was featured in a 2005 episode of the <a href="MTV">MTV</a> <a href="reality%20show">reality show</a> "<a href="True%20Life">True Life</a>: I Want the Perfect Body 2". It was in the same episode that it was mentioned he was named the Strongest Teen in the United States. In 2007, "<a href="Men%27s%20Fitness">Men's Fitness</a>" magazine named him among the world's “25 Fittest Men”.
The 6'2, 295-pound Nee, who has a degree in supply chain management from <a href="Arizona%20State%20University">Arizona State University</a>, resides in the Boston, MA area.
